questions.title: Complete the table of tenses used in Reported Speech
Which word? Write the correct homophone to complete the sentences.
questions.question: I told __ several times not to go to that party. __ __ is blue. (her / hair). Timmy is sick. He __ __ slices of pizza (eight / ate). Look at the __, my __. Beautiful! (son / sun). The __ met every __ with King Arthur. (night, knights). __ brother is very nice. __ not! (you're / your)

questions.title: Complete the table of tenses used in Reported Speech
Complete the reported questions.

questions.content: 'Did you like the documentary on plastic in the oceans?'. He asked the students...
questions.answer: if they had liked the documentary on plastic in the oceans.

questions.content: 'Have you ever swum in the Pacific?'. She asked..
questions.answer: if they had ever swum in the Pacific.

questions.content: 'Who is your favorite science teacher?'. My mom asked...
questions.answer: who my favorite science teacher was.

questions.content: 'Are you going to participate in the plastic recycling campaign next month?'. The teacher asked...
questions.answer: if we were going to participate in the recycling campaign next month.

questions.content: 'How many straws do you use a month?'. We asked...
questions.answer: how many straws we used a month.

questions.title: Change these sentences to Reported Speech. Use the information in parenthesis.

questions.content: 'Don't move.' (tell / police officer to the criminals)
questions.answer: The police officer told the criminals not to move.

questions.content: 'Please, write your name on this line.' (ask / teacher to the students)
questions.answer: The teacher asked the students to write their name on that line.

questions.content: 'Do not litter in public places.' (ask / police officer to beach goers)
questions.answer: The police asked the beach goers not to litter in public places.

questions.content: 'Help me with my Math homework, please.' (ask / my brother to me)
questions.answer: My brother asked me to help him with his Math homework.

questions.content: 'Write a 2-page composition about 'Gyres in the Pacific' for Monday.' (asked / English teacher to students)
questions.answer: The English teacher asked the students to write a 2-page composition about  'Gyres in the Pacific' for Monday.

questions.title: Read the questions and provide an answer.

questions.content: What's the past tense of the verb LEAK?
What's the noun of the verb "pollute"?
What's the adjective of the verb "renew"?
What's the adjective of the noun "resources"?
Is CONSERVATIONIST an adjective or a noun?
Do we say 'polluted water' or 'pollut water' to refer to dirty water?
If "consumption" is a noun, CONSUME is a verb or an adjective?
"Electricity bill" refers to one item, when you refer to 3 or 4 of them, do we say "Electricities bill" or "Electricity bills"?
What verb would you use with the adjective "efficient", 'to be' or 'to eat'?

questions.title: Complete the sentences. Choose the correct adverb.
questions.question: Have you had dinner __? We __ did our homework. We started early and only took us an hour. Let's have some ice cream. No, thanks. I __ had some. People are __ talking about the concert. It was great. If there's a lot of traffic, Mary won't be home __

questions.title: Answer the questions. Use the words in parentheses.

questions.content: When are you gang to buy those shoes you wanted? (already)
Did you read that book I lent you last month? (Yes, just)
Did Susan win any prizes? (No, yet)
questions.answer: No, she hasn't won any yet.

questions.content: Your mother is very upset. What's wrong? (just heard some bad news)
questions.answer: She's just heard some bad news.

questions.content: Did you see that movie everybody is talking about? (No, yet)
questions.answer: No, I haven't seen it yet.

questions.title: Complete the paragraph. Use 'already', 'just', 'yet' or 'still'. You may use these adverbs more than once.
questions.question: We've __ heard that the new project to help save 'vaquita porpoise' started two days ago. Environmentalists are __ working with authorities in order to regulate fishing in that area of the Gulf of California. There have __ been meetings to discuss such regulations; however they haven't come to any conclusion __. Have you over seen pictures of this animal? It is a small species and delicate as well. It seems that people haven't understood __ how important to respect habitats is and what is worse the major damage caused to Nature. The problem is __ here, what are you doing to help?

questions.title: Rewrite the sentences

questions.content: The students not have researched this topic before.
questions.answer: The students haven't researched this tonic before.

questions.content: Have you never swum in the ocean?
questions.answer: Have you ever swum in the ocean?

questions.content: We have collect big variety of coffee mugs.
questions.answer: We have collected a big variety of coffee mugs.

questions.content: Maria and Paul hasn't finished the project yet.
questions.answer: Maria and Paul haven't finished the project yet.

questions.content: She have be a vegetarian since 2015.
questions.answer: She has been a vegetarian since 2015.

questions.title: Complete the sentences. Use the Simple Past or the Present Perfect of the verbs in parentheses.
questions.question: Three months ago John __ (move) to a bigger apartment. Dr. Smith has __ (work) with the same team of doctors for over three years. My cousins __ (live) in Paris for 10 years. They are back in Mexico. __ you __ (go) to Mary's party last night? Mr. Sanchez __ (be) an English teacher for 20 years.

questions.title: Complete the sentences with since or for.
questions.question: Jacob has been in Japan __ March. I have known Sebastian __ many years. He loves fruit. We have been friends __ kindergarden. I haven't seen Susy __ a while. She hasn't visited her parents in Germany __ 2016.

questions.title: Choose the past perfect from these sentences.
questions.question: We drink red wine. __. It is complicated. __. Tom studies French. __

questions.title: Write numbers 1 or 2 to Indicate which action happened first or second in each sentence
questions.question:
After she had eaten dinner __ she did her homework. __.
When she had finished the laundry __ she called her friend. __
They went shopping __ after they had been paid. __
By the time we showed up __ everybody had already left. __
They didn't go to the picnic __ because they had been sick. __

questions.title: Match the clauses to form sentences.

questions.text: Sam started to work for a company

answer.text: after he had finished college in 2011.
after they had spent 2 years in Moscow.

questions.title: Write numbers 1 or 2 to Indicate which action happened first or second in each sentence
questions.question: A fully grown human or animal: __. A band wore around the waist to hold clothing to one's body: __. A defect __. A consequence from acts, combination of circumstances: __. Hard, not easy: __. To behave in an obnoxious manner: __. A substance consisting mainly of sodium: __. A bed covering: __. A member of one of the ancient peoples in Western Europe: __. A chemical element: __.

questions.question: __  I was a student. __  a couple of days. __ a year. __ October. __ half an hour. __ ages. __ 2013. __ 3 o'clock. __ months. __ my parents got married.

questions.question: The __ was __ playing with her __. To give __ to someone because you owe it is to __. We use __ to talk about something what is __ to happen. Tom is so __ that he never makes his bed in the mornings. An event to enjoy ourselves on the day we were born is a __ __

questions.title: Read the sentences and write if they are requesting (R) , permission (PE), expressing possibility (P) and expressing doubt (D).

questions.content: I may go to Panama but I am not sure
Do you think we may see you soon?
May I have some more coffee, please?
Karla my not arrive in time. She left work just 20 minutes ago.
You may eat whatever you want. You finished your treatment.
It may rain tonight. It's cloudy, look!
May we show you what we did for homework?
Josh and I may take a few days off after we finish the project.
My mom may not eat that much. Remember she's watching her portions.

questions.title: Complete with MAY or MIGHT according to the information.
questions.question: My teacher said that I __ go to Summer school if my grades do not improve. It __ be lovely, but it is very expensive. Yes, you __ go when you finish your dinner. My boss didn't feel ok today. He __ not come tomorrow. I cannot remember who lent my dictionary to. I think Ivanna __ have it. No, you __ stay up that late. School starts at 8 am. __ I borrow your lap top for a couple of hours? It is an emergency. If George doesn't finish the presentation he __ not be ready for his exam tomorrow.

questions.title: These are some abbreviations used with text messaging. Write their meanings.

questions.question: If I had passed the English test, my parents __ me that special gift. We __ by if we __ the time. Really! If __ before, I could have helped you. If the plane __ time, we __ missed our connection. Would you __ me if you'd known the truth?

questions.content: We invited Mary to the movies.
